Vienna
THE MONTE CRISTO STRINGS
Vienna, capital of Mittel
leuropa on the shores of the Blue Danube, is once
again "the
musician's holy city". The new State Opera serves as the scene for many a dazzling reception,
reminiscent of that carefree era of wine-women-and-waltz-time.
The Viennese flock to hear the Vienna Philharmonic. the Vienna svmphony and the
Volksoper, where the "Merry Widow", symbol of "Vienna" throughout the world for a
generation, is still the all-time favorite. The silvery voices of the Vienna Boys' Choir still fill the
Hofbura Chaoel. and even the famous white Lipoizaner horses at the spanish hialng schoo
perform their graceful pirouettes to the strains of Mozart and Strauss. Viennese strolling
beneath the baroque arcades hum the lilting "Emperor Waltz"; the bittersweet sound of the
zither floats up from the smoky kellers; and Schrammel quartets in the taverns sentimentalize
on the new wine and lilac time.
Music is the life of Vienna
a. and what other nations say with words, the viennese say with
, Schubert,
Rivaling Vienna's status as the music capital of Europe is its prestige as an art center. Few
museums in the world are so richly endowed not only win masterpieces by bruegner
Rembrandt. Titian, raphael and Rubens out also with antountes trom cgypt note
and Greece.

The Viennese are a hospitable, gracious people who typify that indefinable word,
They like their coffee with globs от whipped cream
and golden goulash. some say they are as proud or their strude as trey die or tell orauss

Danut is ta huge ("Third Man") ferris wheel in the Prater, an
Nothing, however, brings to mind the gaiety and beauty of Vienna as does the waltz, the
melodies of Lehar and Strauss which set the world a-whirling a century ago. As performed
by the Monte Cristo strings, this repertoire of old favorites captures the passionate heartbeat
of Vienna itsell.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Phonograph record by The Monte Cristo Strings promoting Pan American World Airways, titled Destination Vienna; a. record cover; color photographic image of the Schonbrunn Palace with album name and artist on purple luggage tag, description of Vienna and list of songs on reverse;b. LP record; turquoise center with text “Destination Vienna The Monte Cristo Strings” on top center, white script “Cavalier” near right edge.c. white and gray paper sleeve.
